published_attributes.title: Why we should write tests?
published_attributes.serialized_body:
Testing the software is very important part of development flow. We perform manual tests almost all the time. When we commit our code we are 100% sure everything is working. But there is one problem.

Software is changing constantly. After some time we might add few lines of code to implement something new and never know it broke a features implemented previously.

published_attributes.title: Why we don't write tests?
published_attributes.serialized_body:
When you ask other developers, almost everyone will agree that tests are important and we should write them. But when you look at the real projects, many of them do have very low code coverage, and a few does not have any tests!

The main reason I hear every time is lack of time.

Creating good tests takes some time, but as well as any other skill, we need practice to get better at it. In my experience the most time consuming parts of writing tests was overcoming issues I never spotted before. Why my component using Link from react-router isn't rendering properly. How to mock Redux Store? Once you know it, testing becomes a pleasure.

published_attributes.title: What you will learn in this programme?
published_attributes.serialized_body:
In this programme I will walk you through the most important features of React Testing Library. I will show you solutions to most common issues with testing.

We will explore how to mock API calls, deal with user events and integrate with external libraries like Redux and React Router.

published_attributes.title: Why not Enzyme?
published_attributes.serialized_body:
Enzyme, with its rich API, allowed developers to access and manipulate internals of React Components. React Testing Library was created as an answer to bad testing practices.

Its mission is to allow developers to test React Components the same way users use them. It means you can't directly manipulate component state or access and call internal methods.

You can find a way to do the same things with Enzyme, but React Testing Library will force you to use better practices.

published_attributes.title: How should I prepare?
published_attributes.serialized_body:
Start by creating a new projects using Create React App which comes with React Testing Library by default. Use it as a playground to do the exercises.

Do not just read the content but follow along and try out the provided code examples in your local environment. Complete all exercises listed at the end of each course. At the end you will be able to write tests for most common scenarios without hours spend on searching for the right solution.
